rev.comment: /* Gnosticism in popular culture */ calling these movies gnostic is a stretch
the article lacks accessibility - pls improve by including some general characteristics (GC) in the intro, and make the GC section more meaningful as a whole
dualism isn't very descriptive word for the first paragraph. myth is more neutral word than a story, which sounds like fiction. Myth is a scientific term.
/* Theology */ the word "myth" should be "story" for NPOV (if there is a modern following)
Alphabetized and cathegorized sources, real book references on all except Longfellow
ref. to Argentinian industrial band does not illuminate Gnosticism
From [[Wikipedia:Categorization#When to use categories]]: "An article should not be in both a category and its subcategory - - - An exception would be an article that defines a category
converted some sources to correct markup, continue some other time

changes in sentence order for continuity, tweaks

/* Gnosticism in modern times */ typo correction
/* General characteristics */ "hidden" and "esoteric" are somehow synonimous, Mysticism does not fit much
removing two recently added links to weblog entries. i agree that they are interesting, bu they are not large enough.

keep the thelema links in their own articles

same film pattern as the others

Again removing the apostle Thomas from the list of notable Gnostics. The author of The Gospel of Thomas is uncertain, and several early Christian movements appreciated it, not only Gnostics.
rv - adding Thomas back in - see talk
removing apostle Thomas from the list of notable gnostics. there is no proof that he was.
/* General characteristics */ Irenaeus provides a lot of this material
/* Gnostic texts */ corrected find date of Nag Hammadi texts
see [[Talk:Valentinius]] for the explanation why I removed some text.
Moved paragraph on the Valentinians to [[Valentinius]].
removing a link to New Dawn magazine, which writes about occultism in general. not specific enough. removing a link to Gnotic world, which has an excessively broad definion of Gnosticism
removing two links than are related to Aleister Crowley, not ancient Gnosticism. The user who added them also created an advertisement about Thelemapedia in Meta-Wiki, which is aggravating
/* Gnosticism in modern times */ Fixed Monolith Soft link
correct Emile Cioran to corect spelling
rv - I couldn't find Emil Sioran or a book by that author - please discuss on talk page if I am in error
Sioran's book "the evil creator" or "bad creator"(?) is a typical gnostic book
/* Valentinians */ "Orthodox" and "rigid doctrinal" is redundant. Plus it add words that mean the same thing twice, in a sentence that otherwise would say something. *wink*
a cartoon isn't significant enough for a link
sorry, wikipedia is flunking up edits right now...

revert. Weor's ideas differ significantly from the ancient Gnosticism

revert, I can't see the anon's edit adding anything correct
